item.title: CEO says she’d welcome an AI-bot board member: ‘If you don’t have an AI agent in every meeting, you’re missing out’
item.description: Hanneke Faber speaks about the value of AI in decision making at Fortune’s Most Powerful Women conference.

item.title: Strava CEO says the $2 billion unicorn plans to go public ‘at some point’ as marathon-obsessed Gen Z swaps dating apps for run clubs
item.description: CEO Michael Martin said a public listing would provide easy capital for future acquisitions.

item.title: The rare Taylor Swift backlash, explained: Why some fans feel jilted by the star’s tradwife, almost MAGA-coded turn
item.description: Earlier this month, Swift told the BBC it was “shockingly offensive” to ask whether she was dropping her last album before getting married and having ...

item.title: Top analyst warns that ‘larger than expected correction is likely’ if Trump and China don’t kiss and make up
item.description: If the truce in the trade war doesn’t resume by early November, Morgan Stanley’s Mike Wilson writes, brace for a 10% to 15% haircut.

item.title: Gavin Newsom signs law to regulate AI, protect kids and teens from chatbots
item.description: Newsom, who has four children under 18, said California has a responsibility to protect kids and teens who turn to AI chatbots.
